meanings.definition: To surpass in pity or compassion.
meanings.sent1: She always outpities her friends when they are feeling sad.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outpity others by offering help without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The puppy outpities the kitten by sharing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The old man's eyes outpity the hardships he has endured.
meanings.sent5: Her heart outpities all, overflowing with kindness.

meanings.definition: To show more pity or compassion than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Sarah tends to outpity her classmates when they are struggling.
meanings.sent2: The nurse outpities everyone with her caring nature.
meanings.sent3: The cat outpities the dog by sharing its treats.
meanings.sent4: His gentle touch outpities any words of comfort.
meanings.sent5: Their actions outpity their words, showing true empathy.
